original: Hilding Olav, fil. mag., iäroveriksadjunkt, Norrköpinig, f. 12/8/ 88 i Malmö av folikskoll. O. W. o. Hilmia Lundgren. G. m. Rakel Hedlund. Barn: Karin f. 16, fil. kand., folkskoll., Gunnar 17, fil. lic., tf. prof., Axel Tryggve 18, fil. dr,’ Ingemar 22, civiling. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 06, v. mek. verks t. 06-07, stud. v. tekn. ’högsk. 07-09, fil. mag. i Lund 12, folkskoll :ex. där 13. Provår d Sthlm 20. Vik. adj. v. Sthlms folksk:sem. 13, ord. lär. v. Munka-Ljungib}^ folkhögsk. 13-19, lär. v. Palmgren ska sk. i Sthlm 20-25, adjunkt i Härnösand 24, adj. i geogr., matem. o. fysik v. h. a. 1. i Norrköping fr. 30. , Eric Sixten C: son, direktör, Troillhättan, f. 25/1/01 i öckerö, Gbgs o. Boh. 1., av övermask. Sven Carlsson o. Emelia Wennerberg. G. 313 m. Iris Eikström. Barn: Nils-Gunnar f. 36, Karl-Eric 46. — Stud. v. samrealsk. i Trollhättan 16, v. Filip Holmqvists hand:inst. 16, 23. Anst. v. Trollhätt. Tryckeri A-B o. Tidn. Trollhättan fr. 17, kassör 23, annonschef 27, kamrer 39, verkst. dir. 48. Styr :led. i Trollhiätt. Tryck. A-B fr. 39, i Fastig^h. A-B Rödjan fr. 39, ansv. utg. f. Tidn. Trollhättan o. Lilla Edet Posten fr. 44. Led. av ’stadsifullm. fr. 47, av tax:nd. Rev. i Västergötl. tidn:-utg:fören., i Älvsib. 1. hantv :distr., v. ordf. i Trollhätt. ind:- o. hantv :fören., ordf. i Julfemman, v. ordf. i Barnens dagfören. Medl. av Odd Fellow, Göt. förb., Rotarykl. Hob’by: filatetli.
translated:
Hilding Olav, Master of Philosophy, associate teacher at upper secondary school, Norrköping, born on 12/8/88 in Malmö to elementary school teachers O.W. and Hilmia Lundgren. Married to Rakel Hedlund. Children: Karin, born in 1916, with a Bachelor's degree, elementary school teacher; Gunnar, born in 1917, with a Master's degree, acting professor; Axel Tryggve, born in 1918, with a Doctorate in Philosophy; Ingemar, born in 1922, civil engineer. Education: graduated from high school in Malmö in 1906, worked in a mechanical workshop in 1906-1907, studied at the technical university from 1907-1909, obtained a Master of Philosophy degree in Lund in 1912, received a teaching certificate for elementary school there in 1913. Substitute teacher at the Stockholm Elementary Teachers' Seminar in 1913, regular teacher at Munka-Ljungby Folk High School from 1913-1919, teacher at Palmgren School in Stockholm from 1920-1925, associate teacher in Härnösand from 1924, associate teacher in geography, mathematics, and physics at a local secondary school in Norrköping from 1930. 

Eric Sixten C:son, businessman, Trollhättan, born on 25/1/1901 in Öckerö, Gothenburg and Bohus County, son of superintendent Sven Carlsson and Emelia Wennerberg. Married to Iris Eikström. Children: Nils-Gunnar, born in 1936, Karl-Eric, born in 1946. Education: studied at a secondary school in Trollhättan in 1916, at Filip Holmqvist's institute of commerce in 1916 and 1923. Employed at Trollhättan Printing Company and Trollhättan Newspaper from 1917, treasurer in 1923, advertising manager in 1927, accountant in 1939, executive director in 1948. Board member of Trollhättan Printing Company from 1939, board member of Real Estate Company Rödjan from 1939, responsible editor of Trollhättan Newspaper and Lilla Edet Posten from 1944. Member of the City Council from 1947, member of the tax committee. Auditor in the Association of West Gothia Newspaper Publishers, in the Elfsborg County skilled crafts district, vice chairman of the Trollhättan industry and skilled crafts association, chairman of the Christmas charity event "Julfemman," vice chairman of the Children's Day Society. Member of the Odd Fellow, Gothenburg Association, and Rotary Club. Hobby: philately.
